Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdeql] <Biomech-Founder> here Some of us are still having issues regarding the fork that occured at block 61648. If you are not currently in sync with the block explorer, do not make ANY transactions, as they will end up being reversed. The main chain has resolved the fork, but there is some work to be done to get your wallet properly in sync, and any transactions on the fork will be lost. (not the coins, the transactions). As soon as we are certain of the fix, I will post it up here and in announcements. We have been working hard on this in the background, and consulting with the Komodo team as well.  If you are up to date with the explorers, all is well. If not, hang loose, help is on the way.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdeql] <Biomech-Founder> There were several updates to komodo over the course of this coin, I missed one a few days before the fork. I'm pretty obsessive about it, so of course the one I missed is critical üòõ But in my testing over the last couple days, the newest version catches the chain and sees the fork almost immediately, older versions do not. It wasn't flagged as a critical update, but even so, it seems to be the cause.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrdeql] <Biomech-Founder> The coin supply and other key metrics are fine before and after, and no unusual network traffic, so to the best of my ability to track it, this does not seem to be malicious or deliberate in any way. Just one of those things üò¶
